title: CameraType
content:
{
    "title": "CameraType",
    "description": "",
    "content": "This file is automatically generated. Please don't edit it manually.
To submit a bug report on the content, see
https://devforum.roblox.com/c/bug-reports/documentation-issues/72

name: CameraType
type: enum
summary: |
  Describes the camera behavior mode if using the default PlayerScripts.
description: |
  The CameraType Enum is used in Class.Camera.CameraType to set the behavior
  of the Camera object.

  Attach, Watch, Track, and Follow all require a valid
  Class.Camera.CameraSubject to work properly.
codesamples: []
tags: []
deprecationmessage: ''
items:
  - name: Fixed
    summary: |
      Camera is stationary.
    value: 0
    tags: []
    deprecationmessage: ''
  - name: Attach
    summary: |
      Camera moves with the subject at a fixed offset and will rotate as the
      subject rotates.
    value: 1
    tags: []
    deprecationmessage: ''
  - name: Watch
    summary: |
      Camera is stationary but will rotate to keep the subject in the center of
      the screen.
    value: 2
    tags: []
    deprecationmessage: ''
  - name: Track
    summary: |
      Camera moves with the subject but does not rotate automatically.
    value: 3
    tags: []
    deprecationmessage: ''
  - name: Follow
    summary: |
      Camera moves with the subject and rotates to keep the subject in the
      center.
    value: 4
    tags: []
    deprecationmessage: ''
  - name: Custom
    summary: |
      Default mode used by Roblox core scripts.
    value: 5
    tags: []
    deprecationmessage: ''
  - name: Scriptable
    summary: |
      No default behavior. Used when developers need to script custom behavior.
    value: 6
    tags: []
    deprecationmessage: ''
  - name: Orbital
    summary: |
      The camera has a fixed Y position, but can be rotated around the player.
    value: 7
    tags: []
    deprecationmessage: ''",
    "source": "CameraType.yaml"
}
